image.altText: Trish and Ian, two older people, stand and smile in a garden outside a house.

props.synopsis: Stellulata is a purpose-built co-housing project designed by three Canberra couples who wanted to enjoy both privacy and maintain community connections as they age.

title.children: Three Canberra couples create communal home by changing planning laws

image.altText: A crowd of people waving flags walks along a street.

props.synopsis: Pro-Palestinian demonstrations were held across the country today, with organisers claiming crowd numbers to be in the tens of thousands.

title.children: Around 2,000 turn out in Canberra for pro-Palestinian demonstration

image.altText: Three uniformed police officers stand next to a police car parked in front of a house surrounded by police tape.

props.synopsis: A 24-year-old man is charged with murder after a 55-year-old man with significant facial injuries was found dead at a home in Goulburn on Friday morning.

title.children: Man charged with murder after 55yo found dead in Goulburn

image.altText: Jane Dahlstrom looks through glass at specimens

props.synopsis: At the Peter Herdson Museum at Canberra Hospital are more than 1,500 preserved organs and tissues, used to teach medical students and other health professionals about the inner mysteries of the human body.

title.children: 'Rather unusual letter': Personal donations build a museum of body parts

image.altText: A picture of the Ainslie Football Club emblem on a brick wall.

props.synopsis: Zoning changes to a Canberra football club are approved, paving the way for hundreds of new terrace homes, apartments and townhouses to be built on the side of its oval.

title.children: Football club site zoning changes pave the way for new Canberra homes

image.altText: A lawyer with sunglasses outside court

props.synopsis: Zali Burrows's description of Bruce Lehrmann's appeal against last year's defamation ruling neglected that her client was the applicant — and now appellant — in a civil proceeding.

title.children: Bruce Lehrmann's lawyer forgets key detail: the defamation case was his idea

image.altText: A man with short hair wearing a yellow, white and black sweater sits in a classroom smiling, with children in the background.

props.synopsis: After never seeing primary school teaching as a career path, Ryan Brown now believes he's found his "calling", but he's one of just two male classroom teachers at his Canberra primary school.

title.children: In a male teacher drought, Ryan is an endangered breed

image.altText: A dusty valley with small roads and paths cut into the side of a hillside, which sits beside a small collection of buildings.

props.synopsis: The E1 settlement, approved last week by the Israeli government after years of delays due to international pressure, would effectively bisect the West Bank — something its backers and opponents both acknowledge would devastate the prospects of a future Palestinian state.

title.children: Israeli settlers encroached on the West Bank for decades. This is different

image.altText: A mid-shot shot of a man and a woman posing for a photo standing up inside their living room.

props.synopsis: As her daughter's mental health reached crisis point, WA mother Simone tried in vain to find help amid the state's buckling health system.

title.children: Teen in mental health crisis waits 60 hours in Perth ED without treatment

image.altText: Benedict Bryant in a suit outside court

props.synopsis: Confronting CCTV footage played to a Sydney court has revealed the moment an Indigenous teenager collided with an unmarked police vehicle on a trail bike at an intersection, as the trial of an officer charged over the incident begins.

title.children: Officer 'established roadblock' before teen's fatal collision, court told

image.altText: A young woman stands on a rooftop with Sydney harbour in the background.

props.synopsis: English tests are required for many visas but some applicants have serious concerns about the costs and contradictions of the system.

title.children: Apsara speaks fluent English — but had to pay almost $3,000 to prove it

image.altText: A screen showing stock markets results, as seen through a window.

props.synopsis: The Australian share market has made history by surpassing 9,000 index points, which is a boon to millions of workers' super funds. But analysts are not sure how long it can last.

title.children: $4 trillion of super at risk of potential market plunge

image.altText: image of middle aged man holding a large photo of an older man with a stern expression in a garden

props.synopsis: Stephen Douglas died in a seven-minute attack by a patient during a home visit. The situation bore "significant similarities" to another workplace stabbing 12 months earlier.

title.children: Family of mental health nurse killed by a client demands reform

image.altText: Daniil Medvedev breaks his racquet after losing

props.synopsis: A chorus of boos and jeers has rained down on the men's 13th seed, Daniil Medvedev, at the US Open after his opponent was granted a first serve on match point.

title.children: US Open villain rages at umpire, smashes racquets in first-round defeat

image.altText: Umpire James Keothavong speaks to an Australian fan in the stands at the US Open.

props.synopsis: A fan is sent out of Australian Jordan Thompson's first-round victory at the US Open, much to the delight of other members of the crowd.

title.children: Australian booted out of US Open match after Frenchman complains

image.altText: ASX

props.synopsis: Comments from Fed chair Jerome Powell send Wall Street higher as the odds of a US rate cut shorten. The ASX jumps in response and heads for a record close. Follow live.

title.children: ASX rallies after Jerome Powell signals possible rate cut

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: ASX stays afloat in the tempest: JP Morgan
ASX loses momentum as investors bail on banks

image.altText: Five AFP and ABF officers stand at a media conference with plastic packages containing cocaine on a table and the ground.

props.synopsis: A former Australian soldier who served in East Timor is given a 25-year jail sentence for picking up cocaine dropped in the ocean and transporting it to WA tourist towns.

title.children: Former soldier sentenced over two massive cocaine importation operations

image.altText: Kajiki typoon

props.synopsis: Authorities in Vietnam are planning to evacuate more than 586,000 people on the east coast as Typhoon Kajiki intensifies.

title.children: Typhoon Kajiki forces evacuation of over 500,000 in Vietnam

image.altText: a young girl in the arms of a woman who has her face blurred

props.synopsis: Details about the lead-up to the alleged murder of a 12-year-old Gold Coast girl with a disability have been revealed at a bail hearing for her mother in the Supreme Court.

title.children: Girl who allegedly died of malnutrition spent hours in cupboard, court hears

image.altText: John Howard

props.synopsis: New analysis argues that under John Howard, the Liberal Party became increasingly influenced by a social conservatism that emphasised traditional gender norms.

title.children: Howard paved the way for Abbott, Morrison and the Liberal Party's 'women problem'

image.altText: Black and white still from CCTV footage of a man wearing a Scream mask and black clothing riding an e-scooter

props.synopsis: Police allege the South Yarra man targeted a local synagogue six times this year.

title.children: Man charged with multiple graffiti attacks on Melbourne synagogue

image.altText: Nigerian military

props.synopsis: The rescued hostages include some of those kidnapped during an attack on a mosque that left more than 50 people dead last week.

title.children: Nigerian military rescues 76 hostages

image.altText: A large column of smoke seen over the skyline of Sanaa

props.synopsis: Houthi media outlets say two people are dead. Israel says the strikes were retaliation for a missile launch by the Houthis on Friday.

title.children: Israeli retaliatory strikes hit Yemeni presidential palace

image.altText: Three different polaroid images of the same young girl

props.synopsis: A Queensland court has heard there is an "extremely large" case against a third person charged in relation to the murder of Bundaberg teenager Pheobe Bishop.

title.children: 130 witness statements against man accused of using murdered teen's phone

image.altText: A bus engulfed in flames as seen from side of road at night.

props.synopsis: Tasmanian musician Samuel Wellings, known as Kim Dracula, has made a lucky escape after their tour bus caught fire in the early hours of the morning in Texas.

title.children: Australian performer Kim Dracula wakes to tour bus on fire in US

image.altText: woman with white blonde hair and wearing a navy suit looks down the camera

props.synopsis: A posthumous memoir by Virginia Giuffre, who alleged she was trafficked for sex to Prince Andrew by Jeffrey Epstein, will be published later this year.

title.children: Epstein accuser Giuffre wrote a memoir. Months after her death, it's coming out

image.altText: A large white and red ferry comes in to dock while people in the foreground watch from a wharf.

props.synopsis: The ship will stay in Hobart for about two months, then it will be moved to Victoria until it's ready to be used on the Bass Strait crossing in a year's time.

title.children: Spirit of Tasmania IV set for storage in Victoria after Hobart fit-out

image.altText: A ute has smashed into petrol bowsers in the WA town of Kojonup

props.synopsis: Police charge a 28-year-old man after he allegedly stole two vehicles and crashed one into a petrol station in Western Australia's south, with the moment of impact caught on CCTV.

title.children: Service station erupts in fireball as stolen ute smashes into bowsers

image.altText: A man sits in a boardroom wearing a suit.

props.synopsis: Adler starred as Tony Soprano's adviser Hesh Rabkin across all six seasons of The Sopranos and played law partner Howard Lyman in The Good Wife.

title.children: Jerry Adler, star of The Sopranos and The Good Wife, dies aged 96

image.altText: A golfer stands smiling widely at the cameras as he holds a large trophy after a tournament.

props.synopsis: The PGA Tour's nearly man, with six runner-up and 30 top-five finishes, finally breaks his duck in a big way, taking out the PGA Tour play-offs title — and Tiger, LeBron and Caitlin Clark are quick to congratulate him.

title.children: Finally Fleetwood: English golfer wins $15m Tour playoff title as first PGA success

image.altText: A close up of a whale tail flicking water

props.synopsis: Whale poo found on a remote South Australian beach has the potential to help protect endangered southern right whales from climate change, by revealing clues about their diet and gut health.

title.children: Whale poo washed up on remote beach could help protect species

image.altText: Boundary Umpire Greta Miller throws the ball in.

props.synopsis: Over the weekend, Melissa Sambrooks, Kaitlin Barr and Greta Miller became the first ever female AFL boundary umpires.

title.children: 'Couldn't stop smiling': First female boundary umpires in AFL

image.altText: A Ukrainian flag in a London street.

props.synopsis: Demonstrations are held in Ukraine and across Europe as the country marks its 34th year of independence and the fourth year since Russia's invasion began.

title.children: Vance says Russia granting concessions as Ukraine marks independence
